title: diagnostics: suggest .iter().collect() instead of .into() if possible

labels.name: A-diagnostics
labels.description: Area: Messages for errors, warnings, and lints

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.

If you cannot produce a minimal reproduction case (something that would work in
isolation), please provide the steps or even link to a repository that causes
the problematic output to occur.
-->

Given the following code: <!-- Please provide a link to play.rust-lang.org -->

```rust
use std::ffi::OsStr;
use std::path::PathBuf;
fn main() {
    let x = vec![
        OsStr::new("home"),
        OsStr::new("matthias"),
        OsStr::new("rust"),
    ];
    let path: PathBuf = x.into();
}
```

The current output is:

```
error[E0277]: the trait bound `PathBuf: From<Vec<&OsStr>>` is not satisfied
 --> src/main.rs:9:27
  |
9 |     let path: PathBuf = x.into();
  |                           ^^^^ the trait `From<Vec<&OsStr>>` is not implemented for `PathBuf`
  |
  = help: the following implementations were found:
            <PathBuf as From<&T>>
            <PathBuf as From<Box<Path>>>
            <PathBuf as From<Cow<'a, Path>>>
            <PathBuf as From<OsString>>
            <PathBuf as From<String>>
  = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `Into<PathBuf>` for `Vec<&OsStr>`

For more information about this error, try `rustc --explain E0277`.
error: could not compile `playground` due to previous error
```
It would be great if we could somehow suggest `.iter().collect()` here because this works:

````rust
use std::ffi::OsStr;
use std::path::PathBuf;
fn main() {
    let x = vec![
        OsStr::new("home"),
        OsStr::new("matthias"),
        OsStr::new("rust"),
    ];
    let path: PathBuf = x.iter().collect();
}

````


````
rustc 1.59.0-nightly (e95e084a1 2021-12-19)
binary: rustc
commit-hash: e95e084a14870a718c712936ab5a8f8cd0159485

````
